1const BASE_URL = '/api';
     2
     3async function request<T>(path: string, options?: RequestInit): Promise<T> {
     4  const res = await fetch(`${BASE_URL}${path}`, {
     5    headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', ...options?.headers },
     6    ...options,
     7  });
     8  if (!res.ok) {
     9    const error = await res.text();
    10    throw new Error(`API error ${res.status}: ${error}`);
    11  }
    12  if (res.status === 204) return undefined as T;
    13  return res.json();
    14}
    15
    16export const api = {
    17  // Projects
    18  listProjects: () => request<import('../types').Project[]>('/projects'),
    19  createProject: (name: string, path: string) =>
    20    request<import('../types').Project>('/projects', {
    21      method: 'POST',
    22      body: JSON.stringify({ name, path }),
    23    }),
    24  cloneProject: (repoUrl: string) =>
    25    request<import('../types').Project>('/projects/clone', {
    26      method: 'POST',
    27      body: JSON.stringify({ repo_url: repoUrl }),
    28    }),
    29  getProject: (id: number) => request<import('../types').Project>(`/projects/${id}`),
    30  deleteProject: (id: number) =>
    31    request<void>(`/projects/${id}`, { method: 'DELETE' }),
    32
    33  // Board
    34  getBoard: (projectId: number) =>
    35    request<import('../types').BoardView>(`/projects/${projectId}/board`),
    36
    37  // Issues
    38  createIssue: (projectId: number, title: string, description: string, column: string = 'backlog') =>
    39    request<import('../types').Issue>(`/projects/${projectId}/issues`, {
    40      method: 'POST',
    41      body: JSON.stringify({ title, description, column }),
    42    }),
    43  getIssue: (id: number) => request<import('../types').IssueDetail>(`/issues/${id}`),
    44  updateIssue: (id: number, data: { title?: string; description?: string; priority?: string; labels?: string[] }) =>
    45    request<import('../types').Issue>(`/issues/${id}`, {
    46      method: 'PATCH',
    47      body: JSON.stringify({
    48        ...data,
    49        labels: data.labels ? JSON.stringify(data.labels) : undefined,
    50      }),
    51    }),
    52  moveIssue: (id: number, column: string, position: number) =>
    53    request<import('../types').Issue>(`/issues/${id}/move`, {
    54      method: 'PATCH',
    55      body: JSON.stringify({ column, position }),
    56    }),
    57  deleteIssue: (id: number) =>
    58    request<void>(`/issues/${id}`, { method: 'DELETE' }),
    59
    60  // Pipeline
    61  triggerPipeline: (issueId: number) =>
    62    request<import('../types').PipelineRun>(`/issues/${issueId}/run`, { method: 'POST' }),
    63  getPipelineRun: (id: number) =>
    64    request<import('../types').PipelineRun>(`/runs/${id}`),
    65  cancelPipelineRun: (id: number) =>
    66    request<import('../types').PipelineRun>(`/runs/${id}/cancel`, { method: 'POST' }),
    67
    68  // Agent Team
    69  getRunTeam: (runId: number) =>
    70    request<import('../types').AgentTeamDetail>(`/runs/${runId}/team`),
    71  getTaskEvents: (taskId: number, limit: number = 100) =>
    72    request<import('../types').AgentEvent[]>(`/tasks/${taskId}/events?limit=${limit}`),
    73
    74  // GitHub OAuth
    75  githubStatus: () => request<import('../types').GitHubAuthStatus>('/github/status'),
    76  githubDeviceCode: () => request<import('../types').GitHubDeviceCode>('/github/device-code', { method: 'POST' }),
    77  githubPollToken: (deviceCode: string) =>
    78    request<{ status: 'pending' | 'complete'; access_token?: string }>('/github/poll', {
    79      method: 'POST',
    80      body: JSON.stringify({ device_code: deviceCode }),
    81    }),
    82  githubConnectToken: (token: string) =>
    83    request<{ status: string }>('/github/connect', {
    84      method: 'POST',
    85      body: JSON.stringify({ token }),
    86    }),
    87  githubRepos: () => request<import('../types').GitHubRepo[]>('/github/repos'),
    88  githubDisconnect: () => request<{ status: string }>('/github/disconnect', { method: 'POST' }),
    89
    90  // GitHub Sync
    91  syncGithub: (projectId: number) =>
    92    request<import('../types').SyncResult>(`/projects/${projectId}/sync-github`, {
    93      method: 'POST',
    94    }),
    95};
    96

614/// `DELETE /api/projects/:id`  delete a project and all associated data.
   615///
   616/// Cascades to issues, pipeline runs, and agent data via foreign keys.
   617///
   618/// **Response:** `204 No Content` on success.
   619async fn delete_project(
   620    State(state): State<SharedState>,
   621    Path(id): Path<i64>,
   622) -> Result<impl IntoResponse, ApiError> {
   623    let deleted = state
   624        .db
   625        .call(move |db| db.delete_project(id))
   626        .await
   627        .map_err(|e| ApiError::Internal(e.to_string()))?;
   628    match deleted {
   629        true => {
   630            broadcast_message(&state.ws_tx, &WsMessage::ProjectDeleted { project_id: id });
   631            Ok(StatusCode::NO_CONTENT)
   632        }
   633        false => Err(ApiError::NotFound(format!("Project {} not found", id))),
   634    }
   635}
   636
   637/// `GET /api/projects/:id/board`  get the Kanban board state for a project.
   638///
   639/// Returns all issues grouped by column (backlog, ready, in_progress, in_review, done).
   640///
   641/// **Response:** `200 OK` with a `BoardView` object as JSON.
   642async fn get_board(
   643    State(state): State<SharedState>,
   644    Path(id): Path<i64>,
   645) -> Result<impl IntoResponse, ApiError> {
   646    let board = state
   647        .db
   648        .call(move |db| db.get_board(id))
   649        .await
   650        .map_err(|e| ApiError::Internal(e.to_string()))?;
   651    Ok(Json(board))
   652}
   653

Perfect! Now I have all the information I need. Let me provide a comprehensive summary:

## Summary: Project Card Components and Deletion Functionality

### 1. How Project Cards Are Rendered (Grid and List Views)

**Location:** `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/App.tsx` (lines 192-300)

Project cards appear in the main content area when there are **no active agent runs** (displayed only in the idle state). They use the same responsive layout for both grid and list views:

**Grid View:**
- CSS Grid layout: `repeat(auto-fill, minmax(400px, 1fr))`
- Cards flow responsively with minimum 400px width

**List View:**
- Flexbox layout: `flexDirection: 'column'`
- Cards stack vertically

**Card Structure (Idle Projects):**
Each project card displays:
- **Status Dot** (8x8px) - Gray idle indicator
- **Project Name** (13px, bold) - Truncated with ellipsis
- **Issue Count Subtitle** (11px, secondary text) - e.g., "5 issues"
- **Status Label** - "IDLE" (11px, secondary text)
- **Create Issue Button** (green text, bordered) - Inline action button

**Styling:**
```tsx
backgroundColor: 'var(--color-bg-card)'
border: '1px solid var(--color-border)'
borderLeft: '3px solid var(--color-text-secondary)'
padding: '12px'
gap: '12px'
```

### 2. Delete Project API Endpoint

**Status:**  Already Implemented

**Location:** `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/src/factory/api.rs` (lines 614-635)

**Endpoint Details:**
```rust
DELETE /api/projects/:id
```

**Implementation:**
- Handler function: `delete_project()` (async)
- Returns: `204 No Content` on success
- Cascades to issues, pipeline runs, and agent data via foreign keys
- Broadcasts `ProjectDeleted` WebSocket message to all connected clients

**Database Implementation:**
Location: `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/src/factory/db.rs` (lines 332-338)
```rust
pub fn delete_project(&self, id: i64) -> Result<bool> {
    let count = self
        .conn
        .execute("DELETE FROM projects WHERE id = ?1", params![id])
        .context("Failed to delete project")?;
    Ok(count > 0)
}
```

### 3. Delete Function in Hooks and API Client

**Status:**  All components already in place

#### A. API Client Function
**Location:** `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/api/client.ts` (lines 30-31)

```typescript
deleteProject: (id: number) =>
  request<void>(`/projects/${id}`, { method: 'DELETE' }),
```

#### B. Hook Implementation
**Location:** `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/hooks/useMissionControl.ts` (lines 497-504)

```typescript
const deleteProject = useCallback(async (projectId: number) => {
  await api.deleteProject(projectId);
  // Optimistic removal  WS message will also trigger state cleanup
  setState(prev => ({
    ...prev,
    projects: prev.projects.filter(p => p.id !== projectId),
  }));
}, []);
```

**Features:**
- Calls API to delete on server
- Optimistically removes from local state
- WebSocket handler also updates state when `ProjectDeleted` message arrives

#### C. WebSocket Handler
**Location:** `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/hooks/useMissionControl.ts` (lines 385-405)

```typescript
case 'ProjectDeleted': {
  const deletedId = msg.data.project_id;
  setState(prev => {
    const newProjects = prev.projects.filter(p => p.id !== deletedId);
    const newIssues = new Map(prev.issues);
    const newRuns = new Map(prev.runs);
    // Remove issues belonging to the deleted project
    for (const [id, issue] of newIssues) {
      if (issue.project_id === deletedId) {
        // Also remove runs for this issue
        for (const [runId, run] of newRuns) {
          if (run.issue_id === id) newRuns.delete(runId);
        }
        newIssues.delete(id);
      }
    }
    return { ...prev, projects: newProjects, issues: newIssues, runs: newRuns };
  });
  addLogEntry('system', 'Project deleted');
  break;
}
```

**Cascading Cleanup:**
- Removes project from projects list
- Removes all issues belonging to deleted project
- Removes all pipeline runs for those issues

### 4. UI Integration (Sidebar Delete Button)

**Location:** `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/components/ProjectSidebar.tsx` (lines 142-169)

**Delete Button Features:**
- Positioned absolutely on the right side of each project row
- Hidden by default (opacity: 0)
- Visible on row hover with smooth transition
- Shows confirmation dialog before deletion
- Stops event propagation to prevent project selection
- Confirmation message: `"Delete project 'ProjectName'? This will remove all its issues and pipeline runs."`

**App-Level Handler:**
Location: `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/App.tsx` (lines 107-112)

```typescript
const handleDeleteProject = useCallback(async (projectId: number) => {
  await deleteProject(projectId);
  if (selectedProjectId === projectId) {
    setSelectedProjectId(null);
  }, [deleteProject, selectedProjectId, setSelectedProjectId]);
```

If the deleted project is currently selected, it clears the selection (returns to "All Projects").

### 5. Data Flow Summary

```
User clicks delete button (ProjectSidebar)
    
Confirmation dialog
    
handleDeleteProject() called
    
deleteProject() hook called
    
api.deleteProject(id) called
    
DELETE /api/projects/:id endpoint
    
Database delete_project() executed
    
broadcast_message() sends ProjectDeleted WS event
    
Hook optimistic state update + WS handler cascading cleanup
    
UI updates (project removed from sidebar, state cleaned up)
```

### Key Type Definitions

**WebSocket Message Type:**
Location: `/Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/ui/src/types/index.ts` (line 162)
```typescript
| { type: 'ProjectDeleted'; data: { project_id: number } }
```

**Project Interface:**
```typescript
interface Project {
  id: number;
  name: string;
  path: string;
  github_repo: string | null;
  created_at: string;
}
```

All components are fully integrated and operational. The project deletion system includes:
-  Backend API endpoint with cascading deletes
-  Frontend API client function
-  Custom hook with optimistic updates
-  WebSocket integration for real-time state sync
-  UI component with confirmation dialog
-  Proper state cleanup when deleted project is selected

content.text: The foreign keys have `ON DELETE CASCADE` for `issues` and `pipeline_runs`, but `agent_teams`, `agent_tasks`, and `agent_events` do NOT have cascade deletes. That's likely what's causing the 500. Let me check if foreign keys are enabled.

content.content: 80:            .execute_batch("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;")

content.text: Foreign keys are ON. The issue is that `agent_teams` references `pipeline_runs(id)` without `ON DELETE CASCADE`, so when deleting a project cascades to delete issues, which cascades to delete pipeline_runs, it fails because `agent_teams` still references those runs.

content.text: Found it. The `agent_teams`, `agent_tasks`, and `agent_events` tables are missing `ON DELETE CASCADE`. Since these are created with `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS`, I can't alter existing tables easily with SQLite. The simplest fix is to manually delete the dependent data in the `delete_project` method before deleting the project.

content.content: The file /Users/jdsingh/Projects/AI/forge/src/factory/db.rs has been updated successfully.

lines: pub fn delete_project(&self, id: i64) -> Result<bool> {
+        // Manually clean up agent tables that lack ON DELETE CASCADE.
+        // Chain: project -> issues -> pipeline_runs -> agent_teams -> agent_tasks -> agent_events
+                    JOIN agent_teams at ON t.team_id = at.id
+                    JOIN pipeline_runs r ON at.run_id = r.id
+                    JOIN issues i ON r.issue_id = i.id
+            .context("Failed to delete agent events for project")?;
+                    JOIN pipeline_runs r ON at.run_id = r.id
+                    JOIN issues i ON r.issue_id = i.id
+            .context("Failed to delete agent tasks for project")?;
+                    JOIN issues i ON r.issue_id = i.id
+            .context("Failed to delete agent teams for project")?;

content.text:
The vite dev server is running and proxies to the backend. You'll need to restart the `forge factory` backend process so it picks up the fix. Once restarted, the delete button should work  the issue was that the `agent_teams`, `agent_tasks`, and `agent_events` tables didn't have `ON DELETE CASCADE`, so deleting a project with any pipeline history would fail with a foreign key constraint error.

The fix manually cleans up those three tables (agent_events -> agent_tasks -> agent_teams) before deleting the project row, which then cascades normally through issues and pipeline_runs.

content.text:
It worked. The project was deleted successfully:

- Status bar updated from "2 projects" to **"1 projects"**
- The first "firefly" project was removed from both the sidebar and the card grid
- Event log shows **"Project deleted"** entries
- No console errors  clean 204 response

The fix was nulling out `pipeline_runs.team_id` before deleting the `agent_teams` rows, which broke the circular foreign key dependency chain.
